name: Local Phase Quantization
description: Analyzes local phase information in the frequency domain to detect limited phase diversity in AI-generated textures.
algorithm: LPQ Descriptor with Short-Term Fourier Transform
mechanism: Computes STFT at each pixel neighborhood and quantizes the phase of frequency components. AI images typically exhibit concentrated LPQ distributions with limited phase diversity.
parameters: Window: 5×5, Frequencies: 4 basis, Quantization: 8-bit binary code, Histogram: 256 bins
source: Ojansivu & Heikkilä (2008) — Blur Insensitive Texture Classification, ICISP
useCase: Detecting reduced phase diversity in AI-generated local textures

references.title: Ojansivu, V. & Heikkilä, J. (2008). Blur Insensitive Texture Classification Using LPQ. ICISP.

strengths:
• Blur-insensitive texture descriptor
• Captures phase information lost in magnitude-only methods
• Robust to moderate image degradation
• Complementary to LBP analysis
limitations:
• Computationally expensive
• Limited spatial resolution
• May not capture large-scale patterns
• Best used in combination with other methods
